io.spine.server.storage

Interface Storage<I,M extends com.google.protobuf.Message,R extends ReadRequest<I>>

  • Type Parameters:
    I - the type of identifiers
    M - the type of records
    R - the type of read requests
    All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    CatchUpStorage, InboxStorage, StorageWithLifecycleFlags<I,M,R>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractStorage, AggregateStorage, InMemoryCatchUpStorage, InMemoryInboxStorage, InMemoryProjectionStorage, InMemoryRecordStorage, ProjectionStorage, RecordStorage

    @SPI
public interface Storage<I,M extends com.google.protobuf.Message,R extends ReadRequest<I>>
extends java.lang.AutoCloseable
    The base interface for storages.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void close()
      Closes the storage.
      java.util.Iterator<I> index()
      Returns an iterator over identifiers of records in the storage.
      boolean isMultitenant()
      Verifies whether the storage is multitenant.
      boolean isOpen()
      Verifies whether the storage is open.
      java.util.Optional<M> read(R request)
      Reads a record from the storage by the specified request.
      void write(I id, M record)
      Writes a record into the storage.

    • Method Detail

      • isMultitenant

        boolean isMultitenant()
        Verifies whether the storage is multitenant.
        Returns:
        true if the storage was created with multitenancy support, false otherwise

      • index

        java.util.Iterator<I> index()
        Returns an iterator over identifiers of records in the storage.

      • read

        java.util.Optional<M> read(R request)
        Reads a record from the storage by the specified request.
        Parameters:
        request - the request to read the record
        Returns:
        a record instance or Optional.empty() if there is no record matching this request
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the storage was closed before

      • write

        void write(I id,
           M record)
        Writes a record into the storage.

        Rewrites it if a record with this ID already exists in the storage.

        Parameters:
        id - the ID for the record
        record - the record to store
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the storage is closed

      • close

        void close()
        Closes the storage.

        Implementations may throw specific exceptions.

        Specified by:
        close in interface java.lang.AutoCloseable

      • isOpen

        boolean isOpen()
        Verifies whether the storage is open.
        Returns:
        true if the storage is open, false otherwise
